page.title: 01Huntley Wood Quarry
page.content:
A.R.C. Western, Huntley Wood Quarry is a sand and gravel pit. It was purchased by A.R.C. in April 1982 from Blue Circle Aggregates. It is called Huntley Wood pit because, before it was a quarry it was part of the wood which still surrounds part of the site.
The origin of this sand and gravel was a river deposit now commonly known as Â£Bunter Sand and Gravel' but its correct name is a conglomerate and sandstone of the Sherwood Sandstone Group.
The quarry is now about 120ft. (approx. 40m.) deep.
